registers.name: CUST_PROD_OEMFW_AUTH_PUK_LOCK
registers.description: Locks CUST_PROD_OEMFW_AUTH_PUK[255:0]. When blown, the operation with fuses is limited according the burnt value (xx1 - fuse writing disabled;x1x - fuse overriding disabled; 1xx - fuse reading disabled).

bitfields.name: WRITE_PROTECTION
bitfields.description: Write protection for CUST_PROD_OEMFW_AUTH_PUK[255:0]. When write protection is blown, it protects the fuses against writing to it.

values.name: DISABLE
values.description: Disable write protection lock.

values.name: ENABLE
values.description: Enable write protection lock.

bitfields.name: READ_PROTECTION
bitfields.description: Read protection for CUST_PROD_OEMFW_AUTH_PUK[255:0]. When read protection is blown, it protects the fuses against reading.

values.name: DISABLE
values.description: Disable read protection lock.

values.name: ENABLE
values.description: Enable read protection lock.

registers.name: CUST_PROD_OEMFW_ENC_SK_LOCK
registers.description: Locks CUST_PROD_OEMFW_ENC_SK[255:0]. When blown, the operation with fuses is limited according the burnt value (xx1 - fuse writing disabled;x1x - fuse overriding disabled; 1xx - fuse reading disabled).

bitfields.name: WRITE_PROTECTION
bitfields.description: Write protection for CUST_PROD_OEMFW_ENC_SK[255:0]. When write protection is blown, it protects the fuses against writing to it.

values.name: DISABLE
values.description: Disable write protection lock.

values.name: ENABLE
values.description: Enable write protection lock.

bitfields.name: READ_PROTECTION
bitfields.description: Read protection for CUST_PROD_OEMFW_ENC_SK[255:0]. When read protection is blown, it protects the fuses against reading.

values.name: DISABLE
values.description: Disable read protection lock.

values.name: ENABLE
values.description: Enable read protection lock.

registers.name: DCFG_CC_SOCU_L1_LOCK

bitfields.name: READ_PROTECTION

registers.name: LIFECYCLE
registers.description: Lifecycle state.

bitfields.name: LIFECYCLE
bitfields.description: Lifecycle state.

values.name: BLANK
values.description: Blank

values.name: OEM_OPEN
values.description: OEM Open

values.name: OEM_SEC_CLOSED
values.description: OEM Secure World Closed.

values.name: OEM_CLOSED
values.description: OEM Closed

values.name: OEM_LOCKED
values.description: OEM Locked

values.name: OEM_RETURN
values.description: OEM Return

registers.name: DBG_EN_LOCK
registers.description: Debug Enable Lock.

bitfields.name: DBG_EN_LOCK
bitfields.description: Debug Enable Lock.

values.name: Open
values.description: The debug access control registers remain open when jumping to customer code.

values.name: Locked
values.description: The debug access control registers are write-locked before jumping to customer code.

registers.name: DBG_AUTH_DIS
registers.description: Debug Authentication Disabled.

bitfields.name: DBG_AUTH_DIS
bitfields.description: Debug Authentication Disabled.

values.name: Enabled
values.description: Debug Authentication enabled

values.name: Disabled
values.description: Debug Authentication disabled

registers.name: TZM_EN
registers.description: Trust Zone Mode Enable.

bitfields.name: TZM_EN
bitfields.description: Trust Zone Mode Enable.

values.name: Disabled
values.description: TZ-M is disabled by default.

values.name: Enabled
values.description: TZ-M is enabled

registers.name: SERIAL_DIS
registers.description: Serial Download Disabled.

bitfields.name: SERIAL_DIS
bitfields.description: Serial Download Disabled.

values.name: Enabled
values.description: ISP path is enabled.

values.name: Disabled
values.description: ISP path is disabled.

registers.name: WAKEUP_DIS
registers.description: Wakeup Disabled.

bitfields.name: WAKEUP_DIS
bitfields.description: Wakeup Disabled.

values.name: Enabled
values.description: Boot-ROM low power wakeup is enabled.

values.name: Disabled
values.description: Boot-ROM low power wakeup is disabled.

registers.name: CUST_PROD_OEMFW_AUTH_PUK_REVOKE
registers.description: Key revocation indicators of CUST_PROD_OEMFW_AUTH_PUK.

bitfields.name: REVOKE_ROTK_1
bitfields.description: Revokes Root of Trust Key 1.

values.name: KEEP
values.description: Keep the RoTK 1.

values.name: REVOKE
values.description: Revoke the RoTK 1.

bitfields.name: REVOKE_ROTK_2
bitfields.description: Revokes Root of Trust Key 2.

values.name: KEEP
values.description: Keep the RoTK 2.

values.name: REVOKE
values.description: Revoke the RoTK 2.

bitfields.name: REVOKE_ROTK_3
bitfields.description: Revokes Root of Trust Key 3.

values.name: KEEP
values.description: Keep the RoTK 3.

values.name: REVOKE
values.description: Revoke the RoTK 3.

bitfields.name: REVOKE_ROTK_4
bitfields.description: Revokes Root of Trust Key 4.

values.name: KEEP
values.description: Keep the RoTK 4.

values.name: REVOKE
values.description: Revoke the RoTK 4.

registers.name: DBG_AUTH_VU
registers.description: These Debug Authentication Vendor Usage fuses are used by customers to restrict debug certificates. Allowed values increment in form of 0x1, 0x3, 0x7, 0xF, 0x1F, 0x3F, ..., etc

registers.name: IMG_KEY_REVOKE
registers.description: These fuses are used to revoke image signing keys separately from root keys. Allowed values increment in form of 0x1, 0x3, 0x7, 0xF, 0x1F, 0x3F, ..., etc

registers.name: CUST_PROD_OEMFW_AUTH_PUK
registers.description: The RoTKTH for P-256 keys will be 256 bits in length, write as-is. The RoTKTH for P-384 keys will be 384 bits in length, users can truncate the value prior to writing the fuse or write it as is and will be truncated automatically.

registers.name: CUST_PROD_OEMFW_ENC_SK
registers.description: 256-bit encryption key used to protect confidentiality of OEM firmware. Typically required for firmware updates using sb3 (SB3KDK).

registers.name: DCFG_CC_SOCU_L1
registers.description:
Debug authentication configuration for level 1 customer.
Combinations of PIN and DFLT bits and resulting restriction level:
- PIN=1,DFLT=1: Restriction level 0. Access to the sub-domain is always enabled. This setting is provided for module use case scenario where DCFG_CC_SOCU_NS would be used to define further access restrictions before final deployment of the product.
- PIN=0,DFLT=0: Restriction level 1. Access to the sub-domain is disabled at start up. But the access can be enabled through debug authentication process by providing appropriate Debug Credential (DC) certificate.
- PIN=0,DFLT=1: Illegal setting. Part may lock-up if this setting is selected.
- PIN=1,DFLT=0: Restriction level 3. Access to the sub-domain is permanently disabled and cannot be reversed. This setting offers the highest level of restriction.

bitfields.name: PIN_NIDEN
bitfields.description: Controls non-invasive debugging of TrustZone for Arm8-M defined non-secure domain of CPU0 (AP0).

values.name: DAP
values.description: Use debug authentication. DFLT bit must be zero.

values.name: DFLT
values.description: Behaviour is defined by DFLT bit.

bitfields.description: Controls invasive debugging of TrustZone for Arm8-M defined non-secure domain of CPU0 (AP0).

values.name: DFLT

bitfields.name: UUID_CHECK
bitfields.description: Controls whether to enforce UUID check during Debug Credential (DC) validation. If this bit is set, then the device will only accept a Debug Credential (DC) certificate containing a UUID attribute that is an exact match to the device's UUID.

values.name: Disabled
values.description: UUID matching not required.

values.name: Enabled
values.description: UUID matching required

bitfields.name: FORCE_P256
bitfields.description: Valid only for DCFG_SOCU_L1. Must be set to value 10b, when RoTK is based on P-256. All other values (00b, 01b, 11b) indicate P-384. See Protocol Version (DCFG_VER).

values.name: P-384
values.description: RoTK is based on P-384.

values.name: P-384_0
values.description: RoTK is based on P-384.

values.name: P-256
values.description: RoTK is based on P-256.

values.name: P-384_1
values.description: RoTK is based on P-384.

registers.name: DCFG_CC_SOCU_L2
registers.description:
Debug authentication configuration for level 2 customer.
Combinations of PIN and DFLT bits and resulting restriction level:
- PIN=1,DFLT=1: Restriction level 0. Access to the sub-domain is always enabled. This setting is provided for module use case scenario where DCFG_CC_SOCU_NS would be used to define further access restrictions before final deployment of the product.
- PIN=0,DFLT=0: Restriction level 1. Access to the sub-domain is disabled at start up. But the access can be enabled through debug authentication process by providing appropriate Debug Credential (DC) certificate.
- PIN=0,DFLT=1: Illegal setting. Part may lock-up if this setting is selected.
- PIN=1,DFLT=0: Restriction level 3. Access to the sub-domain is permanently disabled and cannot be reversed. This setting offers the highest level of restriction.

group.name: Versions
group.description: Version counters for various software components in SoC

registers.name: CM33_S_VER_CNT
registers.description: Monotonic counter indicating the minimum secure OEM CM33 firmware version. The number of set bits equals the version number. Allowed values increment in form of 0x1, 0x3, 0x7, 0xF, 0x1F, 0x3F, ..., etc

registers.name: CM33_NS_VER_CNT
registers.description: Monotonic counter indicating the minimum non-secure OEM CM33 firmware version. The number of set bits equals the version number. Allowed values increment in form of 0x1, 0x3, 0x7, 0xF, 0x1F, 0x3F, ..., etc

registers.name: RADIO_VER_CNT
registers.description: Monotonic counter indicating the minimal radio firmware version. The number of set bits equals the version number. Allowed values increment in form of 0x1, 0x3, 0x7, 0xF, 0x1F, 0x3F, ..., etc

registers.name: SNT_VER_CNT
registers.description: Monotonic counter indicating the minimum ELE loadable firmware version. The number of set bits equals the version number. Allowed values increment in form of 0x1, 0x3, 0x7, 0xF, 0x1F, 0x3F, ..., etc

registers.name: CM33_BOOTLOADER_VER_CNT
registers.description: Monotonic counter indicating the minimal CM33 bootloader version. Allowed values increment in form of 0x1, 0x3, 0x7, 0xF, 0x1F, 0x3F, ..., etc

registers.name: CM33_S_VER_CNT_VIRTUAL
registers.description: Virtual counter indicating the secure OEM CM33 firmware version. The integer value of this field indicates the number of set bits in CM33_S_VER_CNT and that number equals the version number. Allowed values increment in form of 0x1, 0x2, 0x3, 0x4, 0x5, 0x6, ..., etc

registers.name: CM33_NS_VER_CNT_VIRTUAL
registers.description: Virtual counter indicating the non-secure OEM CM33 firmware version. The integer value of this field indicates the number of set bits in CM33_NS_VER_CNT and that number equals the version number. Allowed values increment in form of 0x1, 0x2, 0x3, 0x4, 0x5, 0x6, ..., etc

registers.name: RADIO_VER_CNT_VIRTUAL
registers.description: virtual counter indicating the radio firmware version. The integer value of this field indicates the number of set bits in RADIO_VER_CNT and that number equals the version number.Allowed values increment in form of 0x1, 0x2, 0x3, 0x4, 0x5, 0x6, ..., etc

registers.name: SNT_VER_CNT_VIRTUAL
registers.description: Virtual counter indicating the ELE loadable firmware version. The integer value of this field indicates the number of set bits in SNT_VER_CNT and that number equals the version number.Allowed values increment in form of 0x1, 0x2, 0x3, 0x4, 0x5, 0x6, ..., etc

registers.name: CM33_BOOTLOADER_VER_CNT_VIRTUAL
registers.description: Virtual counter indicating the minimal version of the CM33 bootloader. Integer value equivalent to number of set fuse bits. Allowed values increment in form of 0x1, 0x2, 0x3, 0x4, 0x5, 0x6, ..., etc

registers.name: NBU_SEC_BOOT_EN
registers.description: NBU Secure Boot Enable

bitfields.name: NBU_SEC_BOOT_EN
bitfields.description: NBU secure boot enable fuse.

values.name: Disabled
values.description: NBU secure boot is disabled.

values.name: Enabled
values.description: NBU secure boot is enabled.

registers.name: OEM_SEC_BOOT_EN
registers.description: OEM Secure Boot Enable

bitfields.name: OEM_SEC_BOOT_EN
bitfields.description: OEM Secure Boot Enable.

values.name: Disabled
values.description: OEM secure boot is disabled.

values.name: Enabled
values.description: OEM secure boot is enabled.

registers.name: SECURE_STORAGE_VER_CNT
registers.description: Secure Storage Verification Counter. Allowed values increment in form of 0x1, 0x3, 0x7, 0xF, 0x1F, 0x3F, ..., etc

registers.name: SECURE_STORAGE_VER_CNT_VIRTUAL
registers.description: Virtual Secure Storage Verification Counter. Allowed values increment in form of 0x1, 0x2, 0x3, 0x4, 0x5, 0x6, ..., etc
